name: Baked Potato Wedges with Creamy Cheese Sauce and Tofu Bacony Bits
description: Loaded Vegan Baked Potato Wedges - These crispy baked potato wedges are perfection! Baked until crispy and topped with vegan cashew cheese sauce, tofu bacon, and scallions. These just might be potato perfection!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 teaspoon ground dry mustard  (or 1/2 teaspoon of stoneground mustard)
1 teaspoon flour (use corn starch or tapioca starch for gluten-free)
7 ounces of firm or extra firm tofu pressed for 15 minutes
1/2 teaspoon of sugar or maple syrup
A few drops of liquid smoke (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: To make potatoes, slice the potatoes into the wedge size that you want and add to a large saucepan filled with water.
recipeInstructions.name: To make potatoes, slice the potatoes into the wedge size that you want and add to a large saucepan filled with water.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring to a boil. Then continue to boil for 3-4 minutes or until the potatoes are just starting to get soft. Drain and pat well to dry for a few minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring to a boil. Then continue to boil for 3-4 minutes or until the potatoes are just starting to get soft. Drain and pat well to dry for a few minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Then toss the potatoes with oil, salt, and pepper. Spread them on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Then toss the potatoes with oil, salt, and pepper. Spread them on a parchment-lined baking sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: For tofu bacony bits: slice up the tofu into small cubes then add the rest of the ingredients to the tofu bowl and toss well to coat.
recipeInstructions.name: For tofu bacony bits: slice up the tofu into small cubes then add the rest of the ingredients to the tofu bowl and toss well to coat.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread these tofu cubes on another parchment lined baking sheet or a different parchment paper on the same baking sheet with your potatoes.  Tofu might get cooked faster than the potatoes, so use a separate sheet. Spread it in an even single layer.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread these tofu cubes on another parchment lined baking sheet or a different parchment paper on the same baking sheet with your potatoes.  Tofu might get cooked faster than the potatoes, so use a separate sheet. Spread it in an even single layer.

recipeInstructions.text: Put it in the oven at 425 degrees Fahrenheit (220 c) . Check after 15 minutes if the tofu is starting to get crisp on the edges. Move the tofu around so that the tofu can crisp evenly .
recipeInstructions.name: Put it in the oven at 425 degrees Fahrenheit (220 c) . Check after 15 minutes if the tofu is starting to get crisp on the edges. Move the tofu around so that the tofu can crisp evenly .

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the tofu once it's crispy depending on your oven. It might be done at 25 minutes or 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the tofu once it's crispy depending on your oven. It might be done at 25 minutes or 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the potatoes when they are getting brown on some edges. That might take another 5-10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Make your cheese sauce by blending all of the ingredients until smooth. Transfer this cheese mixture into a saucepan over medium heat and cook it until the mixture has thickened evenly.

recipeInstructions.text: You want to keep stirring it frequently because it will start to clump at the bottom.

recipeInstructions.text: Once thickened, remove from heat. Serve the fries topped with the cheese sauce, tofu bacony bits, and green onion, and some black pepper if you like.
